bug.author: DNXie
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
This is a documentation bug. There is an inconsistency of parameter name between the function signature and Parameter section. It is use_uniform in the signature, but use_unifrom in the Parameter section. Link to the document: <denchmark-link:https://mxnet.apache.org/versions/1.6/api/python/docs/api/mxnet/test_utils/index.html#mxnet.test_utils.check_consistency>https://mxnet.apache.org/versions/1.6/api/python/docs/api/mxnet/test_utils/index.html#mxnet.test_utils.check_consistency</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24580222/90995250-5a827200-e589-11ea-8662-6df197db3b35.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Error Message</denchmark-h>
None <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
None <denchmark-h:h2>What have you tried to solve it?</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
We recommend using our script for collecting the diagnositc information. Run the following command and paste the outputs below: <denchmark-code>curl --retry 10 -s https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dmlc/gluon-nlp/master/tools/diagnose.py | python
# paste outputs here </denchmark-code>
OS: ubuntu 18.04 Python: 3.7.6 pip: 20.0.2 numpy: 1.18.5 mxnet: 1.6.0
